result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald D Guderyon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: Repeater, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
The Court sentences Mr. Guderyon  to 3 years of Imprisonment , with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year &  6 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 year &  6 months.  This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH. 

The Court clarifies that this sentence is to begin FORTHWITH; it is NOT ordering it to be consecutive

superMiscConds.notes: --maintain absolute sobriety; no presence in bars or taverns

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations per Agent

--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent

--attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent

--drug testing per Agent

The Court determines that Mr. Guderyon has previously provided a DNA sample and does not require him to provide another

Arresting Agency: JCSD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

Case called at 9:16am [mo]
Defendant Donald D Guderyon in court, in custody with Attorney David Zarwell.  ADA Theresa A Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Mr. Guderyon  waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived

recess: 9:27am--reconvene: 9:40am
Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of " GUILTY  " entered on Count #1 of the Information; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Guderyon guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State and Joint Recommendation of the Parties, the Court reads in and dismisses: Counts #2 and #3

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

The Court sentences Mr. Guderyon  to  3  years of Imprisonment , with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1  year &  6 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  1 year &  6  months.  This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH. 

The Court clarifies that this sentence is to begin FORTHWITH; it is NOT ordering it to be consecutive

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 

The Court gives   0  days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety; no presence in bars or taverns
--drug testing per Agent
--to pay statutory court costs


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
The Court determines that Mr. Guderyon has previously provided a DNA sample and does not require him to provide another
recess: 10:11am
Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection
and Transport the Defendant from Kettle Morraine Correctional on February 29, 2016 for proceedings in Branch 3
Preliminary hearing at 02-29-2016 09:00 am

Cases 15CF307 and 15CF305 called together at 2:00pm [mo]
Co- Defendant Donald D Guderyon appears via video conferencing from KMCI, in custody.   
Co- Defemdant Nathaniel Demontigny appears in court. 
ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court verifies the date of birth and address of each Defendant
--Mr. Demontigny updates his address to the Lannon Stone Motel in Janesville, which is located on Racine St., he is unsure of the actual street address
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
--Both Defendant's indicate they wish to have Counsel

As a Condition of Mr. Demontigny's bond he is to go to the Jefferson SPD office today or tomorrow to have an eligibility determination made/schedule an appointment for eligibility determination

The Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

As to Both Defendants:
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 


As to Mr. Guderyon (Case 15CF307):
The Court requires a $5000   Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--No presence on Lamp Road in the Town of Sumner
--No Contact with the Co-Defendants of this Case, Whitney Rismon or Nathaniel Demontigny 

recess: 2:19pm

Case called at 2:42pm [mo]
Defendant Donald D Guderyon appears via video conferencing from Kettle Morraine CI, in custody. ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Mr. Guderyon indicates that he has not received a copy of the Criminal Complaint; The Court will adjourn this initial appearance unless can be otherwise advised that Mr. Guderyon received a Criminal Complaint
ADA Hall notifies the Court and the State did send a summons and Criminal Complaint to Kettle Morraine, but cannot verify that Mr. Guderyon actually received the Complaint
The Court schedules an adjourned initial appearance to allow Mr. Guderyon to receive the Criminal Complaint
